title: Exodus From Midtown Manhattan Led by Tech and Banks
sub_head: New buildings in trendy neighborhoods downtown and on the West Side are luring companies from the corporate corridors of older, staid offices
body:
Companies are bypassing prime blocks in Midtown Manhattan for neighborhoods further west or downtown, as Park Avenue fades from prominence after decades as a magnet for some of the worldâ€™s biggest companies.
With many employees preferring to work remotely or from home, companies are giving priority to state-of-the-art office towers with outdoor space and buildings in trendier neighborhoods in an effort to lure workers back to their desks.
